pbcoreDescriptionDocument.pbcoreTitle: Evening with series. Ian Hunter. Part 2.
pbcoreDescriptionDocument.pbcoreDescription: David Spero interviews Ian Hunter, who discusses his time in Mott the Hoople and his solo career. Hunter performs songs with James Mastro.
Songs. Resurrection Mary -- I wish I was your mother -- Just another night -- Irene wilde -- Still love rock and roll -- Dead man walkin’ (eastenders) -- All the way from Memphis -- Cleveland rocks.

pbcoreDescriptionDocument.pbcoreTitle: An evening with Ian Hunter. Part 2. At the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

pbcoreContributor.contributor: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum

fields.abstract: Ian Hunter discusses his time in Mott the Hoople and performs songs with James Mastro during “An Evening with Ian Hunter” on May 3, 2001 at the Rock Hall in Cleveland, OH. Performances include “Resurrection Mary,” “I Wish I Was Your Mother,” “Just Another Night,” “Irene Wilde,” “Still Love Rock N Roll,” “Dead Man Walkin’ (Eastenders),” “All the Way from Memphis,” and “Cleveland Rocks.”

Ian Hunter discusses his time in Mott the Hoople and performs songs with James Mastro during “An Evening with Ian Hunter” on May 3, 2001 at the Rock Hall in Cleveland, OH. Performances include “Resurrection Mary,” “I Wish I Was Your Mother,” “Just Another Night,” “Irene Wilde,” “Still Love Rock N Roll,” “Dead Man Walkin’ (Eastenders),” “All the Way from Memphis,” and “Cleveland Rocks.”

Ian Hunter discusses his time in Mott the Hoople and performs songs with James Mastro during “An Evening with Ian Hunter” on May 3, 2001 at the Rock Hall in Cleveland, OH. Performances include “Resurrection Mary,” “I Wish I Was Your Mother,” “Just Another Night,” “Irene Wilde,” “Still Love Rock N Roll,” “Dead Man Walkin’ (Eastenders),” “All the Way from Memphis,” and “Cleveland Rocks.”
